results.title: The Ladybird story
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: The discovery of the Vedalia ladybird beetle in Australia, in 1885; how it benefits humans in controlling harmful pests; exported to America where an entire industry was threatened by the cottony-cushion scale. Life cycle of scale and beetle shown in closeup.

results.title: The Kremlin
results.brief_description: A guided tour of the Kremlin recreating events in Russian history associated with the building from the 12th century up until its present day role as a museum and seat of the Social Government. Shows the great halls, paintings, ikons and treasures which belonged to the Czars.

results.title: The King who loved his family
results.brief_description: A film of historical interest showing many of the less well known photographs of events in the life of the late King George VI. Made on the occassion of his death, the film is a tribute to a man and his family. Includes the funeral procession of King George’s grandfather; the ‘Spreading Chestnut Tree’ game in which the King participated at a holiday camp; the King yachting with his father; the visit to Australia; shipboard games en route to South Africa; an early visit to France; extracts from the abdication speech of King Edward.

results.title: The King's musick
results.creator_credit: Victor M. Gover, Daniel M. Angel and Angel Productions
results.brief_description: A tour of inspection of the Royal Military School of Music at Knellar Hall, Britain. Shows early musical instruments such as the serpent, the shawn and the French hunting horn, and gives an insight into the various methods of training, in conducting and in the playing of different instruments. The film closes with an open air performance of ‘The Evening hymn’ and ‘Abide with me’.

results.title: The Kinetic theory of matter. Parts 1-4
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Presents episodes 1-4 - Diffusion, Expansion, Pressure and Compressibility. Relates properties of solids, liquids and gases - such as diffusion, expansion, pressure and compressibility - to the kinetic theory of matter. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Killing of Angelo Tsakos
results.brief_description: In 1985, Angelo Tsakos, a young Greek-Australian boy from the depressed western suburbs of Sydney was shot dead while driving a stolen car, by a probationary police constable. He was only sixteen. At the inquiry into the incident, three differing versions of the event were described. This film reconstructs these versions and finds questions still unanswered. His family continue in their efforts to get a full enquiry into the killing of Angelo Tsakos.

results.title: The Killifish
results.brief_description: A study of the life cycle of the killifish, showing it in streams and ponds, but principally in aquariums. The physical conditions and feed requirements are explained. Egglaying, and the development of the young fish are shown. Uses Photomicroscopy. English commentary, Japanese subtitles.
